definitions.definition: To be impelled or driven forward by the action of wind upon sails, as a ship on water; to be impelled on a body of water by steam or other power.
To move through or on the water; to swim, as a fish or a waterfowl.
To ride in a boat, especially a sailboat .
To set sail ; to begin a voyage.
To move briskly and gracefully through the air.

examples: The duchess sailed haughtily out of the room.

definitions.definition: To deal out (cards) from a distance by impelling them across a surface.

main_definition: To be impelled or driven forward by the action of wind upon sails, as a ship on water; to be impelled on a body of water by steam or other power.
secondary_definitions: To move through or on the water; to swim, as a fish or a waterfowl.
To ride in a boat, especially a sailboat .
( intransitive ) To set sail ; to begin a voyage.
To move briskly and gracefully through the air.
( intransitive ) To move briskly but sedately .
( card games , transitive ) To deal out (cards) from a distance by impelling them across a surface.
